body_html: @fmassa May I ask why gesv only support A is a square matrix. As I saw from https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/matrix_solve_ls, it support that A is a MxN matrix, and B is a NxK matrix, then solve a matrix X (NxK). If I want to use a non-square matrix A in gesv, would you mind to let me know how to implement in PyTorch?
body_text: @fmassa May I ask why gesv only support A is a square matrix. As I saw from https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/matrix_solve_ls, it support that A is a MxN matrix, and B is a NxK matrix, then solve a matrix X (NxK). If I want to use a non-square matrix A in gesv, would you mind to let me know how to implement in PyTorch?
body: @fmassa May I ask why gesv only support `A is a square matrix`. As I saw from https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/matrix_solve_ls, it support that A is a MxN matrix, and B is a NxK matrix, then solve a matrix X (NxK). If I want to use a non-square matrix A in gesv, would you mind to let me know how to implement in PyTorch?
